campaign_variables.description: (IN GAME) When abandoning settlements; percentage modifier on income
(IN GAME) Public order penatly for each settlement abandoned, for each province the faction ownes. Applies next turn only.
(IN GAME) Public order penatly for each settlement abandoned, for each province the faction ownes. Stored value reducing by 1 each turn.
(IN GAME) If an additional rebel army were to spawn in a region, change the army generator budget variable 'quality multiplier' by this
(IN GAME) If an additional rebel army were to spawn in a region, change the army generator budget variable 'quality offset' by this
(IN GAME) If an additional rebel army were to spawn in a region, damage the buildings by this percent

(IN GAME) Ambush will roll on chance of success, generated from ground type and bonus values. The chance of failure is split into failure and critical failure. The propotion of failure that is critical is defined here. Clamped between 0.0 and 1.0
(IN GAME) Percentage of the maximum garrisoned army armed citizenry force that will exist immediately after a region has changed hands.
(IN GAME) Percentage of the maximum garrisoned navy armed citizenry force that will exist immediately after a region has changed hands.
(IN GAME) Chance of capturing an artillery unit from the losing side after a battle (percent 0-100)
(IN GAME) Losing alliance must be at least below X unary of maximum for wipe out. from 0.0 to 1.0. E.g. Force max soldiers is 200, end soldier count is 50, threshold will check against 50/200 = 0.25.
(IN GAME) Winning alliance must be above X proportion strength to wipe out loser. Must be positive. E.g. Winner has 200 units, Loser has 30 units, calculation will check against (200/30) = 6.66
(IN GAME) Damage multiplier for full naval units in autoresolver sea battles. 1.0 is no change.
(IN GAME) Damage multiplier for army transport units in autoresolver sea battles. 1.0 is no change.
(IN GAME) Scale for damage applied by excess melee units in the autoresolver. Must be > 0.
(IN GAME) Scale for damage recieved by excess melee units from single entity units in the autoresolver. Must be > 0.
(IN GAME) Scale for damage recieved by excess melee units in the autoresolver. Must be > 0.
(IN GAME) Modifier on the missile range used in ranged combat. Units will query the BCOP using a range of THIS*effective_missile_range.
(IN GAME) Damage multiplier to ramming damage of ships. Ramming damage is applied at the same time as melee damage.
(IN GAME) Initial seperation when calculating ship ramming damage in unit vs unit. Combat prediction is Ramming vs Passive.
(IN GAME) Number of towers for the defender in fortified autoresolver battle.
(IN GAME) Number of towers for the defender in unfortified autoresolver battle.
(IN GAME) The battle time a reinforcement arrives on the field. 0 will be instant (waiting for them to arrive). Must be positive
(IN GAME) variation in autoresolver predictions. Must be positive or 0.
(IN GAME) variation in autoresolver predictions. Must be positive or 0.
(IN GAME) variation in autoresolver predictions. Must be positive or 0.
(IN GAME) variation in autoresolver predictions. Must be positive or 0.
(IN GAME) variation in autoresolver predictions. Must be positive or 0.

(IN GAME) Scales the generals autoresolver accuracy. The scale is linear from (0 units) to (THIS value), with the accuracy multiplied from (0) to (1). The scale is calculated as ((lowest num units in alliace) / THIS)
(IN GAME) The time step of autoresolver battles. Must be positive. Small values will misrepresent unit stats. Large values will misrepresent range and movement.
(IN GAME) Base kps for towers. Kps is reduced by target unit shield effectiveness and target unit size.
(IN GAME) Multiplier on autoresolver tower damage for level 1 towers. Calculated as (damage = (base_damage * THIS))
(IN GAME) Multiplier on autoresolver tower damage for level 2 towers. Calculated as (damage = (base_damage * THIS))
(IN GAME) Multiplier on autoresolver tower damage for level 3 towers. Calculated as (damage = (base_damage * THIS))
(IN GAME) Multiplier on autoresolver tower damage for level 4 towers. Calculated as (damage = (base_damage * THIS))
(IN GAME) Maximum ammo per sec based on full unit size. Max ammo per second is VALUE * unit_size.
(IN GAME) Max melee kills per second proportion of enemy unit. Kills per second can only be VALUE times larger than opponent.
(IN GAME) Max ranged kills per second. Flat amount, must be VALUE or below.
(IN GAME) Minimum kills per second at full strength. Min kills per second is VALUE * combat time (calculated in combat prediction)
(IN GAME) Min kills per ammo is AMMO USED / (VALUE) * full unit size
(IN GAME) Min ranged kills per second flat value.
(IN GAME) Autoresolver percentage building damage per enemy siege euqipment
(IN GAME) Autoresolver percentage building damage per enemy unit
(IN GAME) When alliance has more units in melee than opponent (excess melee units), the amount of damage they take from the unit they attack
(IN GAME) Multiplier for chase down damage (post battle)
(IN GAME) The difference in heath lost to mark a unit to have damaged transferred from them. E.g. 0.2 means that if the average health lost is 0.15, units with health loss of > 0.35 will be marked.
(IN GAME) Value > 0 to enable post battle damage transfer

(IN GAME) The max difference from average health lost. E.g. 0.3 means that if the average health loss it 0.15, transferring units should lose a maximum of 0.45. The exact value depends on the original damage taken, and will be in the range (0.15-0.45) in this example
(IN GAME) The minimum proportion of health a "transfering to" unit can drop to. E.g. 0.2 means that units won't drop below 20% of their max health
(IN GAME) Proportion of damaged units that are split into the "transfer damage from" list. All theer damaged units are put into the "transfer damage to" list

(IN GAME) If non-zero then when the autoresolver is calculating outcomes between a flying unit and a non-flying melee unit in a skirmish situation then the flying unit uses the entire skirmish combat time.
(IN GAME) Percentage modifier on damage dealt by flying creatures to non-flying creatures in melee in the autoresolver.
(IN GAME) Percentage modifier on damage received by flying creatures from non-flying creatures in melee in the autoresolver.
(IN GAME) Amount by which the autoresolver unary mana pool is reduced per round, per point of mana cost of all spells in an alliance.
(IN GAME) Used in autoresolver modifiers. Enemey hp modifier is multiplied by (MAX_HP - ENEMY_HP) / (MAX_HP - MIN_HP).
(IN GAME) The min battle time before units can retreat. Must be positive
(IN GAME) Used in autoresolver modifiers. Enemey hp modifier is multiplied by (MAX_HP - ENEMY_HP) / (MAX_HP - MIN_HP).
(IN GAME) Number of excess melee units that take damage from their targets
(IN GAME) The number of units on the field multiplier to allow units to retreat. can retreat if num_units * VALUE > enemy_num_units.
(IN GAME) KPS modifier applied in the autoresolver by a buff special ability with scaled combat potential of one.
(IN GAME) KPS modifier applied in the autoresolver by a buff special ability with scaled combat potential of zero.
(IN GAME) Combat potential value for special abilities in autoresolver that results in a scaled combat potential of one.
(IN GAME) Damage done in the autoresolver by a damage special ability with scaled combat potential of one.
(IN GAME) Damage done in the autoresolver by a damage special ability with scaled combat potential of zero.
(IN GAME) The maximum distance between the closest opposing units in the autoresolver before damage special abilities will be used.
(IN GAME) KPS modifier applied in the autoresolver by a debuff special ability with scaled combat potential of one.
(IN GAME) KPS modifier applied in the autoresolver by a debuff special ability with scaled combat potential of zero.
(IN GAME) Scaled combat potentials in the autoresolver are clamped to be no higher than this when applied.
(IN GAME) Scaled combat potentials in the autoresolver are clamped to be no lower than this when applied.
(IN GAME) Starting unit stregth retreat threshold. Between 0 and 1. unit retreats is strength is less than VALUE * 100 percent.
(IN GAME) Remaning strength of a unit to wipe out. Unit will be wiped out if strength percentage < VALUE * 100. Between 0 and 1
(IN GAME) Autoresolver percentage wall damage per enemy srtillery unit
(IN GAME) Autoresolver percentage building damage per enemy siege euqipment if defenders lose
(IN GAME) Autoresolver percentage building damage per enemy unit if defenders lose
(IN GAME) Autoresolver wall damage, additional damage per additional wall breach
(IN GAME) Kills per casualty for battle to be major win. Major win if KPC is > VALUE
(IN GAME) Kills per casualty for battle to be major win. Minor win if KPC is < VALUE
(IN GAME) Strength lost for an army to wipe out. Army will be wiped out if strength lost percentage > VALUE * 100. Between 0 and 1
(IN GAME) Number of resource units always available on the global market for each resource (to prevent division by zero).
(IN GAME) The base amount of TW required for a town to grow its wealth level. Formula: base_wealth_increase*power((total_wealth_increases+1),2)
(IN GAME) Pop growth percentage in every region regardless of farms. We might want to define this on a per-region basis?

(IN GAME) Flat accuracy value used for non-artillery missile units during combat outcome prediction. Used to work-around drastic differences in accuracy at short range by archers/slingers/crossbowmen. Does not affect actual battles, just auto-resolve/prediction.
(IN GAME) The besiegers force size as a percentage of the besieged force size must exceed this threshold for besieged attrition to apply
(IN GAME) The blockaders force size as a percentage of the blockaded force size must exceed this threshold for blockade attrition to apply
(IN GAME) Additional starting funds on easy difficulty
(IN GAME) Additional starting funds on normal difficulty
(IN GAME) Distance to check from the end of an attackers path to find river crossings when detecting river battles
(IN GAME) Multiplier to the cost of converting a building from another culture. This can be modified by bonus values.
(IN GAME) Multiplier to the time of converting a building from another culture. This can be modified by bonus values.
(IN GAME) Minimum cost of coverting a building, cultural or normal conversion.
(IN GAME) The number of turns a slot is empty or ruined before turning into a slum.
(IN GAME) The base cost of dismantling a slum. This can be modified by bonus values. This can be modified by bonus values.

(IN GAME) Base time for which a character will convalesce
(IN GAME) Maximum age for new characters
(IN GAME) Minimum age for new characters
(IN GAME) Chance of a character having a wife when recruited
(IN GAME) The number of turns after retiring a general before they are available to be recruited again.
(IN GAME) Fame level at which civil war will always occur if not triggered earlier.
(IN GAME) Percentage modifier on parent factions GDP that the civil war faction starts with
(IN GAME) Gravitas modifier for characters joining a civil war
(IN GAME) Number of turns taken for the landscape to recover after a destruction incident
(IN GAME) Factions can offet to break their own client state treaties in diplomatic negotiations.
(IN GAME) Factions can offet to break their own defensive alliance treaties in diplomatic negotiations.
(IN GAME) Factions can offet to break their own military alliance treaties in diplomatic negotiations.
(IN GAME) Factions can offet to break their own non-aggression treaties in diplomatic negotiations.
(IN GAME) Factions can offet to break their own soft military access treaties in diplomatic negotiations.
(IN GAME) Factions can offet to break their own trade treaties in diplomatic negotiations.
(IN GAME) Factions can offet to break their own vassal treaties in diplomatic negotiations.
(IN GAME) If non-zero then client states are always invited to join the defender when war is declared, even if the defender doesn't choose to invite allies.
(IN GAME) If non-zero then defensive allies are always invited to join the defender when war is declared, even if the defender doesn't choose to invite allies.
(IN GAME) If non-zero then masters are always invited to join the defender when war is declared, even if the defender doesn't choose to invite allies.
(IN GAME) If non-zero then masters are always invited to join the attacker when war is declared, even if the attacker doesn't choose to invite allies.
(IN GAME) The maximum amount of its income a client state or vassal will give to its protector or master each turn.
(IN GAME) If non-zero then military allies are always invited to join the defender when war is declared, even if the defender doesn't choose to invite allies.
(IN GAME) If non-zero then military allies are always invited to join the attacker when war is declared, even if the attacker doesn't choose to invite allies.
(IN GAME) If non-zero then protectors are always invited to join the defender when war is declared, even if the defender doesn't choose to invite allies.
(IN GAME) If non-zero then client states get released if the you refuse to join them when they are attacked.
(IN GAME) If non-zero then you declare war on your client state if the you refuse to join them when they are attacked.
(IN GAME) If non-zero then defensive alliances get broken if the you refuse to join an ally who is attacked.
(IN GAME) If non-zero then you get released if the you refuse to join a master who is attacked.
(IN GAME) If non-zero then you declare war on your master if the you refuse to join them when they are attacked.
(IN GAME) If non-zero then you get released if the you refuse to join a master when they initiate a war.
(IN GAME) If non-zero then you declare war on your master if the you refuse to join them when they initiate a war.
(IN GAME) If non-zero then military alliances get broken if the you refuse to join an ally who is attacked.
(IN GAME) If non-zero then military alliances get broken if the you refuse to join an ally who initiates a war.
(IN GAME) If non-zero then you get released if the you refuse to join a protector who is attacked.
(IN GAME) If non-zero then you declare war on your protector if the you refuse to join them when they are attacked.
(IN GAME) If non-zero then vassals get released if the you refuse to join them when they are attacked.
(IN GAME) If non-zero then you declare war on your vassal if the you refuse to join them when they are attacked.
(IN GAME) If non-zero then vassals get released if the you refuse to join them when they initiate a war.
(IN GAME) If non-zero then you declare war on your vassal if the you refuse to join them when they initiate a war.
(IN GAME) If non-zero then factions who lose their last region always lose their clients and vassals, event if the faction survives.
(IN GAME) If non-zero then show messages for trespassing armies at the start of each turn.
Smallest payment can offer/demand in diplomacy
(IN GAME) Number of turns that must pass between a break third party trade agreement deal being made and the trade route being able to be re-formed.
(IN GAME) If non-zero then vassals are always invited to join the defender when war is declared, even if the defender doesn't choose to invite allies.
(IN GAME) If non-zero then vassals are always invited to join the attacker when war is declared, even if the attacker doesn't choose to invite allies.
